Value.label: LED Mode
Value.Help: In night-light mode the LED on the switch will turn ON when the switch is turned OFF, instead of following the state of the load.

Value.label: Invert Switch
Value.Help: Change the top of the switch to OFF and the bottom of the switch to ON.

Value.label: Ignore Start-Level (Receiving)
Value.Help: This dimmer will always start dimming from its current level, ignoring any commanded start level.

Value.Help: In night-light mode the LED on the switch will turn ON when the switch is turned OFF, instead of following the state of the load.

Value.Help: Change the top of the switch to OFF and the bottom of the switch to ON.

Value.label: Ignore Start-Level (Receiving)
Value.Help: This dimmer will always start dimming from its current level, ignoring any commanded start level.

Value.label: LED Indicator Control
Value.Help: Choose if you want the LED indicator to turn on when switch is on or off or disable completely.

Item.label: LED on when switch is off
LED on when switch is on

Value.Help: Controls the on/off orientation of the rocker switch

Value.label: Value when the Magnet is triggered
Value.Help: Which value of the Sensor Binary Report or Basic Set will be sent when the door is Opened/Closed

Value.label: Low Battery Check
Value.Help: Enable/disable the low battery checking

Value.label: Interval time of low battery checking
Value.Help: The minimum interval is 4 minutes

Value.label: Report Type to Send
Value.Help: Configure which sensor report will be sent when the door is Opened/Closed

Value.label: Lock/Unlock Configuration
Value.Help: Lock/ unlock all configuration parameters

Value.Help: Reset to factory defaults

Item.label: LED OFF when the load is on
LED ON when the load is on

Value.label: Invert Switch
Value.Help: Change the top of the switch to OFF and the bottom of the switch to ON.

Value.label: Ignore Start-Level When Transmitting Dim Commands
Value.Help: The associated dimmer will start dimming from its current level, ignoring any commanded start level.

Value.label: Dim Step
Value.Help: Dim Step can be set to a value of 1 to 99. This value indicates how many levels the dimmer will change each time the Dim Timer expires.

Value.label: Dim Timer
Value.Help: The Dim Timer (how fast the dim steps happen). It can be set to a value of 1 to 255. This value indicates in 10 millisecond resolution, how often the dim level will change.

Value.label: LED Mode
Value.Help: In night-light mode the LED on the switch will turn ON when the switch is turned OFF, instead of following the state of the load.

Value.label: Invert Switch
Value.Help: Change the top of the switch to OFF and the bottom of the switch to ON.

Value.label: Ignore Start-Level (Receiving)
Value.Help: This dimmer will always start dimming from its current level, ignoring any commanded start level.

Value.label: LED Mode
Value.Help: In night-light mode the LED on the switch will turn ON when the switch is turned OFF, instead of following the state of the load.

Value.label: Invert Switch
Value.Help: Change the top of the switch to OFF and the bottom of the switch to ON.

Value.label: LED Mode
Value.Help: In night-light mode the LED on the switch will turn ON when the switch is turned OFF, instead of following the state of the load.

Value.label: Invert Switch
Value.Help: Change the top of the switch to OFF and the bottom of the switch to ON.

Value.label: Ignore Start-Level (Receiving)
Value.Help: This dimmer will always start dimming from its current level, ignoring any commanded start level.

Value.label: Temperature Reporting Threshold
Value.Help: Threshold change in temperature to induce an automatic report. 1 to 50 ( Set up from 0.1C to 5C)

Value.label: Humidity Reporting Threshold
Value.Help: Threshold change in humidity to induce an automatic report. 1 to 50 ( Set up from 1%-50%)

Value.label: Luminance Reporting Threshold
Value.Help: Threshold change in luminance to induce an automatic report. 0 is disabled. 5 to 50 ( Set up from 5%-50%)

Value.label: Motion Sensor Re-trigger Duration
Value.Help: Value from 1 to 255 minutes to setup the re-trigger time when there is no movement detected in the period of time.

Value.label: Motion Sensor Sensitivity Adjustment
Value.Help: Sensitivity of the integrated PIR sensor. 1 to 7 ( 1 = Most Sensitive )

Value.label: LED Mode
Value.Help: 1 - Turn Off LED 2 - Breathing Light Mode (High Battery Consumption) 3 - Quick Flash on Sensor Reporting or Motion Trigger

Value.label: Button #1 Programmable
Value.Help: Default Mode 0 The button on the Minimote uses the factory default functions for operation instead of any special functionality related to the below modes. Scene Mode 1 The button on the Minimote executes a scene from data received for Parameters Numbers 0-239 related to the button being pressed. Add Mode 2 The button on the Minimote is able to include/add devices into the Z-Wave network. Remove Mode 3 The button on the Minimote is able to remove devices from the Z-Wave network. Association Mode 4 The button on the Minimote is able to associate one device to another. Learn Mode 5 The button on the Minimote is able to allow the Minimote to be included into other Z-Wave networks and to learn Z-Wave network information.

Value.label: Mode
Value.Help: Enable selective Group Mode or Scene Mode when Button is in Use. NOTE: Minimote firmware 1.17 or higher is required, firmware 1.19 is highly recommended.

Value.label: LED Indicator Control
Value.Help: Choose if you want the LED indicator to turn on when switch is on or off or disable completely.

Item.label: LED on when switch is off
LED on when switch is on

Value.label: Orientation
Value.Help: Controls the on/off orientation of the rocker switch

Value.label: Automatically turn switch off after interval
Value.Help: Automatically turn the switch off after this many seconds. 0 is disabled

Value.label: Basic Set Report when sensor is restored
Value.Help: Configures the sensor to send or not send Basic Set commands of 0x00 to nodes in Association group 2 turning the devices off when the sensor is in a restored state (i.e. motion not detected). By default the sensor does NOT send Basic Set commands of 0x00.

Value.label: Basic Set Report
Value.Help: Configures the sensor to either to send or not to send Sensor Binary Report commands to Association Group 1 when the sensor is faulted and restored.
